alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Kenedy; Northern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 11:38PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy, northeastern Hidalgo and southeastern Brooks Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1138 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Rachal, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norias and Rudolph. This includes the following highways... US Highway 77 between mile markers 740 and 756. US Highway 281 between mile markers 738 and 752. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
